alert.note: Alert for Boulder And Jefferson Counties Below 6000 Feet, West Broomfield County; Central and East Adams and Arapahoe Counties; Elbert, Central and East Douglas Counties Above 6000 Feet; Jefferson and West Douglas Counties Above 6000 Feet, Gilpin, Clear Creek, Northeast Park Counties Below 9000 Feet; North Douglas County Below 6000 Feet, Denver, West Adams and Arapahoe Counties, East Broomfield County; North and Northeast Elbert County Below 6000 Feet, North Lincoln County (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 18 at 6:11PM MDT by NWS Boulder
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Douglas, northwestern Elbert, western Arapahoe, east central Jefferson and south central Adams Counties through 700 PM MDT... At 611 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over southwestern Castle Pines, or 18 miles south of Denver, moving northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Aurora, Centennial, Highlands Ranch, Castle Rock, Parker, southern Littleton, Greenwood Village, Lone Tree, Roxborough Park, Bennett, Elizabeth, Kiowa, Larkspur, Perry Park, The Pinery, Franktown, Chatfield Reservoir, Sedalia, Buckley SFB, and Louviers. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: Prepare for sudden gusty winds. Secure loose objects and move to a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
